title: Unable to log in at server. Probably wrong configuration, username or password
content: Yesterday, after my mint 20.3 system updated Thunderbird, it stopped connecting. I purged Thunderbird and deleted the Thunderbird folders from /usr/cache and home/chris directories (can't seem to delete the archive folders). I've tried reinstalling multiple times and get the above error trying to set up my Yahoo mail account. I've tried leaving the "@yahoo.com" on and off my username, tried all the authentication methods. My server settings are correct. I installed Thunderbird on my Macbook yesterday perfectly doing nothing different. Starting in safe mode in terminal gives: [ImapModuleLoader] Using nsImapService.cpp [NntpModuleLoader] Using NntpService.jsm [Pop3ModuleLoader] Using Pop3Service.jsm ATTENTION: default value of option mesa_glthread overridden by environment. ATTENTION: default value of option mesa_glthread overridden by environment. ATTENTION: default value of option mesa_glthread overridden by environment. ATTENTION: default value of option mesa_glthread overridden by environment. [calBackendLoader] Using Thunderbird's ical.js backend console.debug: "Found 0 public keys and 0 secret keys (0 protected, 0 unprotected)" console.debug: "Successfully loaded optional OpenPGP library libgpgme.so.11 from system's standard library locations" console.debug: "gpgme version: 1.13.1-unknown" console.warn: services.settings: Failed to load last_modified.json: TypeError: NetworkError when attempting to fetch resource. console.debug: "Trying to load /usr/lib/thunderbird/libotr.so" console.debug: "Trying to load libotr.so from system's standard library locations" console.debug: "Trying to load libotr.so.5 from system's standard library locations" console.debug: "Trying to load libotr.so from system's standard library locations" console.log: (new Error("Cannot load required OTR library", "resource:///modules/OTRLib.jsm", 109)) console.error: Region.jsm: "Error fetching region" (new TypeError("NetworkError when attempting to fetch resource.", "")) console.error: Region.jsm: "Failed to fetch region" (new Error("NO_RESULT", "resource://gre/modules/Region.jsm", 419)) console.error: Region.jsm: "Error fetching region" (new TypeError("NetworkError when attempting to fetch resource.", "")) console.error: Region.jsm: "Failed to fetch region" (new Error("NO_RESULT", "resource://gre/modules/Region.jsm", 419))

title: Thunderbird Freezes when checking combined inbox on Pop!_OS
content: Whenever I click on my main combined inbox, it seems to "search" my email account. The task takes up a lot of the CPU and the program will become unresponsive and sometimes it even crashes my GUI.
creator: walmas

title: TAGS no longer working for Thunderbird after having multiple email tags for years
content: We have multiple computers accessing the same email, everyone applying a specific tag for their emails. We have had the 5 default ones (names customized), then recently added a 6th for a new employee. Since then each user can only see the tags they apply from their screens, nobody else's tags applied (others appear as regular black color). I have tried updating all the email apps on all users, tried removing that new tag on all computers, rebooted, uninstalled TB on 1 computer while the new tag was removed, still cannot see others' tags. Help please! Is there a settings file I can remove? Or some sort of switch or add-on? Perhaps having to do with a new install of virus Bitdefender? There is an add-on for it in TB. Anyone have issues using TAGS suddenly stop working?
creator: lisafougere22

title: can't send emails
content: I can receive incoming mail ok, but when I try to send mail, I get a message "Login to server xxx with username xxx failed". I have re-entered my details but it won't send. This has been happening for a few days.
creator: mdclement

title: TB not pulling in emails, cursor just spinning
content:
TB was working fine for many months but yesterday, it stopped pulling in emails. I quit it and restarted. All I get when the cursor is hovering in the inbox or certain other places, is the spinning "wait" cursor. I've tried waiting over an hour. Nothing happens. Sending an email - oddly the recipient got it, but the email wouldn't store into the Sent folder.

One solution I found online was to remove indexing files, all the *.msf files. I did that, but no difference.

I have not upgraded TB or anything else on my system, have not rebooted, have not changed any configurations, and my ISP (Bluehost) is paid up. Firefox and all other software using internet is fine. I can access my email by Bluehost's webmail.
creator: darenw

title: Cartella “profilo” probabilmente danneggiata
content:
Ho Thunderbird e Windows 11 entrambi a 64 bit e aggiornati e con due profili situati in un’altra partizione del hard disk . a seguito di un crash del pc uno dei due profili non funziona uscendo una pagina (vd sotto) che dice “Scegli che cosa vuoi configurare”. 

Mmentre l’altro profilo funziona e consente di accedere a tutti i messaggi di posta. La cartella del profilo non funzionante contiene 8 GB. Il file profile.ini punta alle cartelle esatte. Ho provato a creare un altro profilo con diverso nome e diversa cartella e poi incollare in tale cartella i dati della cartella del profilo non funzionante. Ma la cosa non funziona . Poi o provato a creare un altro profilo con diverso nome che puntava ad una cartella contenente già i dati della cartella del profilo non funzionante.  Non funziona . ho provato anche a cliccare su “importa” che compare nella pagina sopra, utilizzando, come veniva proposto nella pagina, la cartella del profilo non funzionante, la procedura si completa ma non funziona lo stesso. ho cercato sia su Google che sul sito Mozilla ma non ho trovato come ripristinare e rendere utilizzabile il profilo.
creator: gipalmisano2

title: Come recuperare intere cartelle email esportate in files msf?
content:
Salve, chiedo un aiuto a chi è più esperto di me... Lo scorso anno o forse anche prima, ho esportato intere cartelle di email (salvate come files.msf), che mi sono resa conto solamente ora il programma non mi consente più di aprire.

Esiste ancora un modo per accedere alle email salvate in questo modo? Fino a non so quanto tempo fa, le importavo semplicemente in una cartella per visualizzarle, funzionalità che non trovo più...

Grazie se qualcuno può aiutarmi Monica

content:

What am I missing here (except, of course, I'm missing the option for importing the primary email!).

Thank you.

title: Thunderbird 64-bit can't read or fully import 32-bit Profiles
content: My main laptop is going into repair. It seems it's still running 32-bit version 102.11.0 Backup laptop is running 64-bit version of the same version Tried copying profile, got the couldn't read profile popup Tried importing, that succeeded, but files are missing. For example, source inbox has 14 emails, destination had 9. I'm assuming that this is a 32-bit/64-bit issue. But before I do something stupid, I want to check in with the group. My thinking is to back-up the Thunderbird folder where the profile is located on my source PC and then upgrade to the 64-bit version. My concerns are: 1-Not sure why I'm still running 32-bit and didn't automatically update to 64-bit 2-Exactly how to do this (just download and install the 64-bit)? But will that happen using Thunderbird Setup 102.11.0.exe, even though the same version is installed. 3-I won't be able to open my profile on any version of Thunderbird.
creator: MIkeyLV

title: Another application is attempting to send mail using your user profile. Are you sure you want to send mail?
content:
Have latest version. Am using an application that needs to email pictures and when it invokes Thunderbird (set as default mail app in Windows 10) I get the message: Another application is attempting to send mail using your user profile. Are you sure you want to send mail?

How can I turn off Thunderbird from bothering me with this and blocking the other application? I would prefer to disable the feature all together.
creator: foolsrussian

title: Address Book Problems on New Computer
content: Using Thunderbird on a Windows 10 PC. Switched to a new computer and transferred (or thought I transferred my profile to the new computer, but cannot get the address book to work. Tried to export/import the address books from the old computer to the new one in both CSV and LDIF formats. The export seems to work as I see the files, but when I click import on the new computer under addressbook, nothing seems to happen. The email addresses that I type into new emails are also not being saved on the new computer. Any assistance is appreciated. Thanks in advance

title: Emails to gmail addresses suddenly return undeliverable
content:
Emails to gmail addresses return undeliverable. I receive this message:

Action: failed Status: 5.7.26 Remote-MTA: dns; gmail-smtp-in.l.google.com Diagnostic-Code: smtp; 550-5.7.26 This mail is unauthenticated, which poses a 

   security risk to the 550-5.7.26 sender and Gmail users, and has been    blocked. The sender must 550-5.7.26 authenticate with at least one of SPF    or DKIM. For this message, 550-5.7.26 DKIM checks did not pass and SPF    check for [my email address] 550-5.7.26 did not pass with ip:    [23.83.218.247]. The sender should visit 550-5.7.26    https://support.google.com/mail/answer/81126#authentication for 550 5.7.26    instructions on setting up authentication.    d2-20020a170902aa8200b001aaf5dcd774si19262143plr.173 - gsmtp

Any assistance would be appreciated. Thanking you.
